docs.lead_paragraph: Texas Gov. Rick Perry would like to run for president in 2016 as a proven job-creator who modeled Texas' strong economy in his own political gunslinger image and says he can do the same for the rest of the country.

headline.main: Rick Perry: Jobs Juggernaut Meets 'Governor Oops'
headline.print_headline: Rick Perry: Jobs Juggernaut Meets 'Governor Oops'

docs.snippet: Texas Gov. Rick Perry would like to run for president in 2016 as a proven job-creator who modeled Texas' strong economy in his own political gunslinger image and says he can do the same for the rest of the country.

docs.lead_paragraph: When Jayson Seaver thinks about why he makes so much money while some Americans can't catch a break, he thinks of the sacrifices he's made, the jobs he worked to pay for college, the 12-hour days he spends at the office now.

headline.main: How Wealth Gap Complicates Sibling Relationships
headline.print_headline: How Wealth Gap Complicates Sibling Relationships

docs.lead_paragraph: The first 50-state report on the latest sign-up season under President Barack Obama's health care law shows that more than 4 million people selected plans for the first time or re-enrolled in what the administration called "an encouraging start."

headline.main: Report: 4 Million Actively Enroll in Health Plans
headline.print_headline: Report: 4 Million Actively Enroll in Health Plans

docs.snippet: The first 50-state report on the latest sign-up season under President Barack Obama's health care law shows that more than 4 million people selected plans for the first time or re-enrolled in what the administration called "an encouraging start."

docs.lead_paragraph: Nearly 6.5 million people either selected or were enrolled in a new individual insurance plan for 2015 on the HealthCare.gov website through Dec. 26, the U.S. government health agency said on Tuesday.

headline.main: Nearly 6.5 Million People in 2015 HealthCare.gov Plans: U.S. Agency
headline.print_headline: Nearly 6.5 Million People in 2015 HealthCare.gov Plans: U.S. Agency

docs.snippet: Nearly 6.5 million people either selected or were enrolled in a new individual insurance plan for 2015 on the HealthCare.gov website through Dec. 26, the U.S. government health agency said on Tuesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: A poor state with a starkly unhealthy populace, Kentucky is becoming a symbol of the Affordable Health Care Act’s potential, and its obstacles.

headline.main: Success of Kentucky’s Health Plan Comes With New Obstacles
headline.print_headline: Success of Kentucky’s Health Plan Comes With New Obstacles

docs.abstract: Kentucky faces problems with Affordable Care Act that are extreme example of nationwide issues; poor state with largely unhealthy populous has seen sharp rise in Medicaid rolls since choosing to expand program though few have signed up for private insurance (Series: Remaking Medicine).
docs.snippet: A poor state with a starkly unhealthy populace, Kentucky is becoming a symbol of the Affordable Health Care Act’s potential, and its obstacles.

docs.lead_paragraph: A sharp drop in Kentucky’s uninsured rate has made it a symbol of the Affordable Care Act’s potential, but some residents still delay signing up.
